verses.text: Be not thou envious against evil men , neither desire to be with them.
For their heart studieth destruction , and their lips talk of mischief. \p
Through wisdom is an house builded ; and by understanding it is established :
And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
A wise man \add is\add* strong ; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.\f + \fr 24.5 \ft is strong: Heb. is in strength\f*\f + \fr 24.5 \ft increaseth…: Heb. strengtheneth might\f*
For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war : and in multitude of counsellors \add there is\add* safety. \p
Wisdom \add is\add* too high for a fool : he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.
The thought of foolishness \add is\add* sin : and the scorner \add is\add* an abomination to men.
\add If\add* thou faint in the day of adversity , thy strength \add is\add* small.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft small: Heb. narrow\f* \p
If thou forbear to deliver \add them that are\add* drawn unto death , and \add those that are\add* ready to be slain ;

If thou sayest , Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider \add it\add*? and he that keepeth thy soul , doth \add not\add* he know \add it\add*? and shall \add not\add* he render to \add every\add* man according to his works ? \p
My son , eat thou honey , because \add it is\add* good ; and the honeycomb , \add which is\add* sweet to thy taste :\f + \fr 24.13 \ft to…: Heb. upon thy palate\f*
So \add shall\add* the knowledge of wisdom \add be\add* unto thy soul : when thou hast found \add it\add*, then there shall be a reward , and thy expectation shall not be cut off. \p
Lay not wait , O wicked \add man\add*, against the dwelling of the righteous ; spoil not his resting place :
For a just \add man\add* falleth seven times , and riseth up again : but the wicked shall fall into mischief. \p
Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth , and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth :
Lest the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* see \add it\add*, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.\f + \fr 24.18 \ft it displease…: Heb. it be evil in his eyes\f* \p
Fret not thyself because of evil \add men\add*, neither be thou envious at the wicked ;\f + \fr 24.19 \ft Fret…: or, Keep not company with the wicked\f*
For there shall be no reward to the evil \add man;\add* the candle of the wicked shall be put out.\f + \fr 24.20 \ft candle: or, lamp\f* \p
My son , fear thou the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* and the king : \add and\add* meddle not with them that are given to change :\f + \fr 24.21 \ft them…: Heb. changers\f*
For their calamity shall rise suddenly ; and who knoweth the ruin of them both ? \p
These \add things\add* also \add belong\add* to the wise. \add It is\add* not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
He that saith unto the wicked , Thou \add art\add* righteous ; him shall the people curse , nations shall abhor him:
But to them that rebuke \add him\add* shall be delight , and a good blessing shall come upon them.\f + \fr 24.25 \ft a good…: Heb. a blessing of good\f*
\add Every man\add* shall kiss \add his\add* lips that giveth a right answer.\f + \fr 24.26 \ft that…: Heb. that answereth right words\f*
Prepare thy work without , and make it fit for thyself in the field ; and afterwards build thine house. \p
Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause ; and deceive \add not\add* with thy lips.
Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work. \p
I went by the field of the slothful , and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding ;
And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns , \add and\add* nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
Then I saw , \add and\add* considered \add it\add* well : I looked upon \add it, and\add* received instruction.\f + \fr 24.32 \ft considered…: Heb. set my heart\f*
\add Yet\add* a little sleep , a little slumber , a little folding of the hands to sleep :
So shall thy poverty come \add as\add* one that travelleth ; and thy want as an armed man.\f + \fr 24.34 \ft an…: Heb. a man of shield\f*
